intro: Camptosema goiasana, commonly known as the Goianese spider plant, is a perennial herb native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, blue to violet flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Camptosema goiasana is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in open fields and disturbed areas.
